title: 111_hr4572
content: The Clean Air Act is amended to exclude certain greenhouse gases from being considered air pollutants based on their impact on global climate change. This amendment includes gases like carbon dioxide, methane, nitrous oxide, hydrofluorocarbons, perfluorocarbons, and sulfur hexafluoride. Additionally, there is a section on the Renewable Fuel Standard. The Clean Air Act excludes international indirect land use change activities from the renewable fuel program and excludes indirect emissions from international land use changes in calculating greenhouse gas emissions. The Clean Air Act is amended to include the Secretary of Agriculture in addition to the Administrator. The definition of renewable biomass is expanded to include materials from National Forest System land and public lands for reducing hazardous fuels. The Clean Air Act is amended to include the Secretary of Agriculture in addition to the Administrator. The definition of renewable biomass is expanded to include materials from National Forest System land and public lands for reducing hazardous fuels, disease or insect infestation, and restoring ecosystem health. The biomass must not be used for higher-value products and must be harvested in accordance with applicable law and land management plans. The Healthy Forests Restoration Act of 2003 is amended to include old-growth maintenance, restoration, and management direction, as well as large-tree retention on National Forest System land and public lands. The Healthy Forests Restoration Act of 2003 is amended to include renewable organic matter sources from non-Federal or Indian land for feed grains, agricultural commodities, plants, trees, and algae. The Healthy Forests Restoration Act of 2003 is amended to include renewable organic matter sources such as algae, crop residue, vegetative waste material, animal waste and byproducts, and food and yard waste.
